Events that occurred on 15 January.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1945 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 94c.
1957 - J.R.R. Tolkien is interviewed by Ruth Harshaw for the NBC radio program "Carnival of Books".
1965 - Actor James Nesbitt is born.
1967 - Philip Norman's interview with J.R.R. Tolkien is published in The Sunday Times Magazine and in The New York Times Magazine.
1970 - Musician Charles Deenen is born.
1972 - The Tolkien Society holds a general meeting and becomes formally constituted.
2005 - The second day of the first "The One Ring Celebration".
2015 - A Brief History of The Hobbit is published.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3019:
The Fellowship of the Ring find the Chamber of Mazarbul and Balin's Tomb. Gimli takes the Book of Mazarbul.
Attack of the Orcs and the Balrog. Gandalf destroys the Bridge of Khazad-dûm and falls with Durin's Bane.
The rest of the Fellowship exits Moria and enters Dimrill Dale.
Gimli, Frodo and Sam gaze in Mirrormere.
Haldir, Rúmil and Orophin meet the Fellowship. They sleep on flets.
Orcs pass through Lothlórien.
